intro: Mollinedia jorgeorum, commonly known as the Jorge's mollinedia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and are adapted for pollination by insects. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
